text:
Hi, i have a problem adding a “Meeting” Element to a HubL-Theme. To create a form selection i use:
```{% form "form" %}```
How can i create the same but for a meeting-element?

does anyone if it is possible to pull in data that is being loaded server side into fields.json file, I have a legacy module that the data is being loaded on blog post page, and trying to set the default value of a field to be a HubL data value, what would be the syntax to do that? I tried to use double curlys like `{{content.widgets.module_15416141242721637.body.area_of_interest_form_field}}`, but in json file it does not like that syntax:
Without curlys does not like syntax either:

Does anyone else have issues when using for loops with elements wrapped in `<a></a>` ??
It doesn't seem to like this.

*Screenshot and code below.* 

<http://homebuyer-com.sandbox.hs-sites.com/-temporary-slug-38853608-3199-490c-ab01-a4578447c741?hs_preview=KBWcNxcu-42041731995#news>
A is not a block level element.
You have to display block it
or display: flex/grid;
But  it's not event wrapping around the whole element. It sets itself apart from the article.
the dom will dom that automagicaly
try adding disply block
Same issue.
OR thre is another item not closed properly
I'll check
That was my first guess so I double checked.
you have an A inside of another a
thats a non starter
here is a trick
make the article relative
add a before to the anchor wrapping the text
Take the other a out did the trick. Just wondering why the loop doesn't like that.
then make the text::before absolute and extend to all corners covering the entire item
it isnt the loop
its HTML
youcant place an anchor inside another anchor
I see
doing what i said will make the entire items clickable
Yup. Got it now, thanks so much for the help!
your welcome

Hi everyone! I am new at HubSpot development, and had some question about hubl
Hi need to get the last blog post at blog-index.html. So a see this solution on docs:
`{% for post in  blog_recent_posts('default', 1)%}`
it works but, it prints de content text on page. How can I see all properties returned from `blog_recent_posts` function ?  for exemple the json data.
Also, I try to use *Developer Info* button has it says in <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/cms/developer-reference/debugging-and-errors#developer-info>
But this button doesn't appears to me. I cant find, *HubSpot sprocket icon in the top right hand corner of live pages > Developer Info* when access page view trhoug this buttom:
